contents.markdown: _Ma_- verbs, another of the big six, are possibly the most common of all verb types in colloquial speech. They are usually AF or OF. A few are DF and a few are both AF and OF, but we will not cover those for simplicity. Other than discussing formation and aspect, which apply to all _ma_- verbs, this lesson will cover AF _ma_- verbs. The next lesson will cover OF _ma_- verbs.
They form AF sentences, with possible variants of AF(O), AF(D) and AF(I).
AF(I) verb actors are experiencers, and the verbs may express experiencing an emotion or something unintentionally.
_Ma-_ verbs are formed by adding _ma_- to the root:
Ex: ma + tuto => matuto to learn
Ex: ma + tulog => matulog to sleep
Ex: ma + matay => mamatáy	to die
_Ma_- verbs follow the same aspect and stress patterns as _mag_- verbs.
These are AF verbs, so as a reminder:

item.tagalog: Nanalo lang si Joe ng piso.
Natutulog ang aso sa kuwarto ko.
item.english: The dog is sleeping in my room.

exampleSentences.english: It is good to learn English.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Sino ang nanalo ng lechon sa tindahan kahapon?
exampleSentences.english: Who won a roasted pig at the store yesterday?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Natutulog ang pusa sa kuwarto nina Angel at Maria.
exampleSentences.english: The cat is sleeping in Angel and Maria's room.
Mother will not die, will she?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Mapupunta ba sa kalsada ang aso?
exampleSentences.english: Will the dog end up in the street?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ano ang pangalan ng sikat na babaeng natuto ng Tagalog para sa iyo?
exampleSentences.english: What is the name of the famous woman who learned Tagalog for you?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Manalo po kayo ng isang libong piso para sa atin.
Namatay din ang nagmaneho ng mabilis na sasakyan.
exampleSentences.english: The one who drove a fast car also died.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ano ang napunta sa bahay nung ikawalo ng Disyembre?
exampleSentences.english: What ended up in the house on the 8th of December?
